meanings.definition: A flower with petals that have a distinct edge of a different color.
meanings.sent1: The picotee in the garden had pink petals with white edges.
meanings.sent2: I planted a picotee in my backyard to add some color.
meanings.sent3: The picotee at the flower show was so vibrant, it seemed to glow.
meanings.sent4: Her dress was like a picotee, with its striking contrast of colors.
meanings.sent5: The picotee stood out among the other flowers with its unique petal edges.

meanings.definition: To have a distinct edge of a different color.
meanings.sent1: She carefully picoteed the edges of the painting with a contrasting hue.
meanings.sent2: The artist decided to picotee the design for a more eye-catching effect.
meanings.sent3: He picotees his drawings to make them pop off the page.
meanings.sent4: The sunset picoteed the sky with shades of orange and pink.
meanings.sent5: The decorator picoteed the room's trim with a bold color choice.
